description: Dive into "Charming Malls of Chiang Mai Adventure" ‚Äî a handpicked list of places with quick notes, links, and essentials for fast trip planning and discovery.
title: Charming Malls of Chiang Mai Adventure

places.generalDescription: Central Festival is a large mall located on the east side of Chiang Mai, just past the bus terminals 2/3. It offers a wide range of options for both tourists and locals, including numerous food choices and a cinema. The layout is similar to other malls in the area but larger in scale. Visitors can enjoy various restaurants and clothing stores, as well as department store specials. The staff are known for their kindness and friendliness, providing assistance with shopping needs.

sources.snippet: One of Chiang Mai‚Äôs newest shopping centers is also one of its largest and most impressive. Located on the north side of town just past the Superhighway, Central Festival is home to a range of internationally-known store...
sources.shortName: Chiang Mai Shopping Malls | 7 Shopping Malls in Chiang Mai

sources.snippet:
Openings Times
Weekdays: 11am ‚Äì 9pm
Fridays: 11am ‚Äì 10pm
Weekends:10am ‚Äì 10pm(Directions)This futuristic 6 storey mall wouldn‚Äôt look out of place in London or New York and has a large range of shops available. Located just off the superhighway, the easiest way to get there is by Grab or Songtaew (red truck). Try to avoid arriving or leaving during rush hour (5-8pm).There are lots to do here at night as well including swanky wine bars and Chiang Mai‚Äôs only IMAX cinema.
sources.shortName: 4 Must-Visit Shopping Malls in Chiang Mai

sources.snippet: The prominent Central Group first arrived near the airport a long while ago and have since added another massive mall to their ever-growing portfolio on the highway near Big C (Central Festival). The modern Maya Mall makes our list too, located in the trendy Niman area, and we‚Äôve also a couple of golden oldies still worth checking out for their bargains and sense of nostalgia. Find our top five shopping malls in Chiang Mai below.
sources.shortName: ¬ª Five Best Malls in Chiang Mai

sources.snippet: Opened just in 2013, Central Festival is the largest shopping mall in Northern Thailand and one of the largest in the country. There is a large number of different shops here, including some more luxury ones such as Marks & Spencer, as well as two cinemas. Run by the national Central Group, it operates according to a well-tested business concept that always works in Thailand.
sources.shortName: Best local markets & shopping malls in Chiang Mai

places.name: Central Chiangmai

reviews.text:
A nice mall.
Definitely It is not a small shooing Centre but not too large mall,  just right,  and it has everything.
It ranked as no 7th largest mall in Thailand.

A one stop shopping kind of mall... good brand are available including Jim Thompson ..

They have supermarket and food bazaar / food courts at the loee ground level .. we enjoyed the food and durian .. as well as lot of local snacks to bring home

It has KFC too on the ground floor just at the entrance

The taxi waiting both is very comfortable... they set it up nicely

A big shopping mall. Much bigger that Central Airport Plaza. Several high-end shops and designer stores also. We were there a few days ago and it was packed with Christmas / Holiday Season shoppers. They do have plenty of parking spaces in the parking garage. The stores were pretty busy and staff were helpful.

Central Chiang Mai is a nice place to shop. It's like a Thai street market that meets a Western mall. They've got everything from big-name international stores to cute little Thai shops, so you're bound to find something you like. The mall itself is super clean and easy to walk around, which is a big plus. Honestly, the food here is the real star. You can grab anything you're in the mood for, whether it's fancy international stuff or some tasty Thai food. There are tons of places to eat, from quick bites to sit-down restaurants ‚Äì something for every budget, too.
The only thing is, apart from the food, some of the other stores can be pricey. Still, overall, Central Chiang Mai is a top-notch spot to hang out for an afternoon or evening. You can shop, eat, and have a good time all in one.

places.address: 99, 99/1 -99/2 ‡∏´‡∏°‡∏π‡πà‡∏ó‡∏µ‡πà 4 Lampang - Chiang Mai Superhighway, Fa Ham, Mueang Chiang Mai District, Chiang Mai 50000, Thailand

places.generalDescription: Central Chiangmai, also known as Central Festival Chiang Mai, is a massive shopping complex located along the Superhighway, just 2 miles northeast of the Old City. Spanning over 60 acres and five floors, it boasts more than 300 stores featuring top global brands, an IMAX theater, and even an ice skating rink. This modern mall offers a wide variety of stores including British brands like Topshoe and Marks and Spencer.

sources.snippet: One of the best shopping malls in Chiang Mai is Central Festival Mall, whose beautiful architecture has had a great impact on its reputation. The main reason for the popularity of this mall is the sale of British brands that you cannot find anywhere else in Chiang Mai. This 5-floor shopping center has more than 300 shops where you can meet your needs in the fields of clothing and sports equipment, electronic equipment, books and stationery.
sources.shortName: Enjoy a Great Shopping with Shopping Malls in Chiang Mai

sources.snippet: This huge project was started in 2010 and should be finished in 2013. It is located near The Child and Family Law Court near Big C Extra. Under the same concept as Central Festival Pattaya, it melds Lanna architecture and decorations with modern design.
sources.shortName: New Chiang Mai shopping malls

places.name: Central Chiangmai

reviews.text:
Central Chiangmai is a vibrant and modern shopping destination that offers a mix of retail, dining, and entertainment under one roof. On the ground floor, you'll find a lively food court serving a variety of traditional Thai dishes, perfect for anyone wanting to experience authentic local flavors. There's also a TOPS supermarket for groceries, snacks, and fresh produce. On the top floor, another spacious food court provides more dining choices, from local favorites to international options.

During my visit, the atmosphere was lively with special promotional events. A beautiful and energetic lady was promoting Nissan cars non-stop on the microphone, drawing a crowd with her enthusiasm. Right after the entrance, another young woman was singing a beautiful song with a warm smile, creating such a welcoming and pleasant vibe - both of them truly deserve appreciation for their talent and effort.

In terms of shopping, the mall features well-known brands such as H&M, Uniqlo, Levi's, Bata, and many more, making it a convenient spot for both fashion and lifestyle needs. The layout is clean and easy to navigate, and the air-conditioning offers a comfortable escape from Chiang Mai's heat. Overall, Central Chiangmai is an excellent place to shop, eat, relax, and enjoy some unexpected live entertainment.

Central Chiang Mai is a nice place to shop. It's like a Thai street market that meets a Western mall. They've got everything from big-name international stores to cute little Thai shops, so you're bound to find something you like. The mall itself is super clean and easy to walk around, which is a big plus. Honestly, the food here is the real star. You can grab anything you're in the mood for, whether it's fancy international stuff or some tasty Thai food. There are tons of places to eat, from quick bites to sit-down restaurants ‚Äì something for every budget, too.
The only thing is, apart from the food, some of the other stores can be pricey. Still, overall, Central Chiang Mai is a top-notch spot to hang out for an afternoon or evening. You can shop, eat, and have a good time all in one.

Huge mall with amazing array of good eats, shopping, and entertainment.

Food court at below ground, ‚ÄòFood Park' and restaurants available on upper floors. There is a cineplex, name brand shoes and clothes shops, Muji, Daiso and so much more.

The mall is  well-maintained, clean and very walkable.

Bathrooms are also clean and well-maintained. Easy to spend a few hours between eating and shopping.

A designated drop off/pick up for grab also available.

places.address: 99, 99/1 -99/2 ‡∏´‡∏°‡∏π‡πà‡∏ó‡∏µ‡πà 4 Lampang - Chiang Mai Superhighway, Fa Ham, Mueang Chiang Mai District, Chiang Mai 50000, Thailand

places.generalDescription: Chiang Mai Night Bazaar is a lively market in Thailand's northern capital, offering a wide array of experiences. The historic center is surrounded by monasteries and temples, with accommodations ranging from traditional homes to modern city hotels. The night bazaar, open from 18:00 to 22:30 daily, features an extensive collection of stalls and shops selling local crafts, souvenirs, street food, clothing, electronics and more.

sources.snippet: The Night Bazaar in Chiang Mai takes place every night and is probably the most popular of all the night markets in the city. Endless rows of beautifully lit stalls are lined up on the main road and in hidden backyards along the way. Most of the stalls sell cheap products like elephant pants, flip flops or knock-off sunglasses and watches but you will also find higher quality items like silk shawls, handmade clothing, or room decor.
sources.shortName: Shopping in Chiang Mai: The Best Markets, Boutiques and Malls

sources.snippet: Everything and anything made around the Chiang Mai region can be found after 17:00 on Chang Klan Road and the surrounding streets. There are t-shirts, silk scarves, carved soap, lamps, fake football tops, scented oils, sweet candies, wooden carvings and more. On the ground floor of the covered Night Bazaar building itself are local painters and sketch artists who do portraits for reasonable fees.
sources.siteName: Chiang Mai Thailand Travel Guide - 1Stop Chiang Mai
sources.shortName: Guide to Markets and Malls in Chiang Mai - Chiang Mai Thailand Travel Guide

sources.snippet: Night markets in Chiang Mai have become increasingly popular in recent years, providing a lively and exciting atmosphere for locals and tourists alike. Chiang Mai night markets are known as one of the best places to store, eat and explore in Thailand. From the colorful street vendors to the diverse food stalls, this bustling marketplace offers something for everyone.
sources.shortName: Chiang Mai Markets and Shopping Malls

sources.snippet: The night market is one of the most important markets in Chiang Mai. Everyone will surely enjoy watching the colorful stalls on the side of the street. This beautiful market is open every day from 5 pm to late at night and you can visit it and find cheaper goods than other places.
sources.shortName: Enjoy a Great Shopping with Shopping Malls in Chiang Mai

sources.snippet: Chiang Mai Night Bazaar has a lot of street stalls, which mainly sell clothing and handicrafts. There are as well as shopping malls where you can find more unique handicrafts and jewelry. Also read: Guides on Chiang Mai Night Bazaar: Stalls, Food, Location & Bargaining Tips
sources.shortName: Top 10 Shopping Malls in Chiang Mai - Thailand Travel Guide

sources.snippet: If you could only pick one place to shop, this is the place to go. The Night Bazaar is a huge network of interconnecting streets filled with vendors selling anything and everything under the sun. Definitely one of the best places to go shopping in Chiang Mai!
sources.shortName: The 12 Best Streets and Markets to Go to

sources.snippet: Chaing Mai Night Bazaar is the most famous market in Chiang Mai, and one of the top tourist attraction in the city. It offers a great shopping experience.
sources.shortName: Chiang Mai Markets & Malls
Top Places To Shopping In Chiang Mai

places.name: Chiang Mai Night Bazaar

reviews.text: The businesses and folk of Thailand really know how to do their night bazaars. A popular event in each of their places, these events are carefully attended to details that attract both the locals and visitors. An incredibly huge amount of work that goes into setting up the events. Involving the necessary infrastructure of tents and tables for the displays, and then the huge variety of goods. The range is exceptional and one is spoilt for choice. Freshly prepared food is definitely a highlight and the pricing is affordable even for the locals. Clothing and other accessories too are easily available and also very affordable. This is definitely a model and pattern that can be copied the world over and many of the poorer countries could benefit from such ventures. A must experience for everyone.

Vibrant, cheerful, colourful - everything you can expect from a tourist staple. The souvenirs  ard overpriced, so do haggle.  There are a lot of food options, bit stick to the traditional items - noodles, fried chicken, banh mis .

A fun filled night bazaar that has food, games and cheap stuff to buy. Be ready to bargain, never take the first price. Best to bring cash as some vendors don't prefer credit (costs them a %)
My favorite was the potstickers or fried dumplings, however you may call them in your part of the world.

places.address: Changklan Rd, Chang Moi Sub-district, Mueang Chiang Mai District, Chiang Mai 50100, Thailand

places.generalDescription: Central Chiangmai Airport, also known as Airport Plaza or Robinson, is a popular shopping destination conveniently located near the airport. It offers a wide range of shops from international brands to local stores, making it ideal for last-minute souvenir shopping. The mall features a supermarket in the basement and various dining options including fast food chains and nicer restaurants.

sources.snippet: Though no longer one of Chiang Mai‚Äôs biggest and best shopping malls, Central Airport Plaza is still a popular spot and convenient place to shop, go out to eat and catch a movie. Located near the Chiang Mai International...
sources.shortName: Chiang Mai Shopping Malls | 7 Shopping Malls in Chiang Mai

sources.snippet: Airport Plaza, sometimes simply referred to as "Robinson" by locals because it houses the department store Robinson, is still one of Chiang Mai's best shopping malls. Conveniently located on the edge of town, with easy and ample parking, and pleasant inner layout with all the shops you really need, it still beats all others. You can find anything here from electronics to clothing, from cheap and basic to luxury items, from simple food at the food court to some nicer dining, and a good cinema.
sources.shortName: Best local markets & shopping malls in Chiang Mai

sources.snippet: Central Airport Plaza is the second biggest mall in Chiang Mai and ‚Äì as the name implies ‚Äì located close to Chiang Mai International Airport. Here you will also find a couple of western shops and a lot of Thai brands. If you‚Äôre looking for a place where you can buy some better quality souvenirs then head to the basement of this mall ‚Äì there are a lot of small shops that offer beautiful, locally-crafted items for a bargain.
sources.shortName: Shopping in Chiang Mai: The Best Markets, Boutiques and Malls

sources.snippet: A newer, cleaner and more modern version of Kad Suan Kaew, Central Airport Plaza is the upmarket shopping destination of Chiang Mai. The Robinson‚Äôs department store is the main feature but there are plenty of specialty shops selling everything from wine to sunglasses. A unique feature of this mall is the Northern Village, a three storey complex offering very high quality handicrafts and housewares.
sources.shortName: Top Places To Shopping In Chiang Mai

sources.snippet: Central Plaza Chiangmai Airport is not only a good place to buy international brands, but also a good place to buy souvenirs. Central Plaza Chiangmai Airport is located within walking distance of the airport where has five layers of shops and restaurants, as well as international supermarkets and cinemas.
sources.shortName: Top 10 Shopping Malls in Chiang Mai - Thailand Travel Guide

sources.snippet: To know: Is it time to know more about Chiang Mai shopping centers?. We strongly suggest Central Chiangmai Airport Shopping Center as one of the best shopping malls in Chiang Mai. It will be a wonderful opportunity to spend some time with your close ones.
sources.shortName: The 6 Best Shopping Malls in Chiang Mai

places.name: Central Chiangmai Airport

reviews.text:
Great opportunity for last minute shopping at decent prices. Some quick tips:

1. Wide variety of food at basement and also at top floor.
2. Supermarket is cheaper than buying stuff at 7 eleven
3. The local Thai brand with.it is stylo, good for ladies
4. The left luggage facility costs 60B for 4 hours.
5. Just 5 mins away from airport with free airport shuttle service at 15 min intervals
6. While waiting can take pic of elephants in fountain area

On the third floor of Central you will find a huge area of electronics and repairing phones and laptops. There are two amazing repairing phone shops with skilled technicians. They are able to do almost everything to save your phone and life. I was helped by both of them with different repairs, they have different abilities on saving damaged phones but they are both amazing. The one working with his wife together save my life and all the data in my precious phone replacing the microprocessor doing a great job. If you have any problem concerning repairing electronics just go to Robinson top floor at @center and you will find this skilled professionals

Planned to visit the mall before our flight at night, its great that there's luggage storage and free shuttle to airport (with any receipt spend in the mall will be free), the mall is under renovation but there still quite a lot of things for us see and also the foodcourt to kill time.

places.address: 9, 9/1 ‡∏´‡∏°‡∏π‡πà‡∏ó‡∏µ‡πà 3 Mahidol Rd, Tambon Pa Daet, Mueang Chiang Mai District, Chiang Mai 50200, Thailand

places.generalDescription: Kad Na Mor Market, also known as Malin Plaza, is a popular night market situated near Chiang Mai University. It's a favorite spot among college students and young people who flock to the area every evening. Despite the crowds, the atmosphere remains relaxed. The market offers an array of affordable trendy clothing for young women, along with numerous street food stalls and various small shops. Additionally, it's recognized for its student-friendly prices on cosmetic products and accessories.

sources.snippet: Kad Na Mor Market (also known as CMU Market, Malin Plaza Night Market) is located just opposite the gates of Chiang Mai University on Huaykaew Rd. The market spans over two separate areas which can be reached from the main road. While it is one of the most popular night markets for locals, not many foreigners find their way here.
sources.shortName: Shopping in Chiang Mai: The Best Markets, Boutiques and Malls

places.name: Kad Na Mor Market

reviews.text:
Local market in front of CMU. Random cute oldie stuff and thrift shopüß∏üöÇ

Easy to commute but fewer food stalls than expectedüòã

Very local market serving mainly students of Chiangmai University.
Cheap food but in small portions. Very nice Logan juice here. Grilled chicken is good too.

There are lots of shops selling clothing and accessories. But they are basically teenagers oriented.
Night market next to another night market. Many food vendors and some are good. Mostly small stores that sell clothes though.

places.address: ‡∏Å‡∏≤‡∏î ‡∏´‡∏ô‡πâ‡∏≤ ‡∏°‡∏≠, Huay Kaew Rd, Tambon Chang Phueak, Mueang Chiang Mai District, Chiang Mai 50300, Thailand

places.generalDescription: One Nimman is a modern marketplace located in Chiang Mai, offering a vibrant mix of retail shops, cafes, and food stalls. The first floor and the third and fourth floors house an arts, culture, and lifestyle living space that seamlessly blends modern architecture with local Chiang Mai culture. Lets Relax Chiang Mai One Nimman provides a serene spa experience within this lively environment. The complex also features European architectural influences that perfectly complement its myriad of shops, restaurants, cafes, and art galleries.

sources.snippet: For our money, One Nimman is Chiang Mai‚Äôs most original and best looking shopping mall, styled after an Italian plaza or European square. One Nimman is a shopping centre and outdoor plaza handily located just across the road from Maya Lifestyle Shopping Centre and Think Park ‚Äì it is easy to find, just look for the Italian bell tower!. We like that One Nimman is a little different from other Chiang Mai shopping centres ‚Äì it has cobbled streets, a piazza plus a beautiful Italian style street (known as One Street) of chic cofffee shops and fashion stores ‚Äì it actually feels kinda like the Bellagio shopping centre in Las Vegas (like kinda fake but still quite cool).
sources.shortName: 8 Best Shopping Malls in Chiang Mai, Thailand

sources.snippet: This charming book store has opened its second branch (about 50m away from its first!) at the latest hot spot in town with more space for all bookworms to browse in. Bibliophiles can stroll, flip pages, and of course buy (real!) books in both Thai and English covering many areas of interest from design and architecture to cooking and travel. At One Nimman, Nimmanhaemin Soi 1 Open 10am ‚Äì 10pm Tel.
sources.shortName: 7 stylish, eclectic shops in Chiang Mai

sources.snippet: To know: One Nimman Shopping Center is a perfect option to make when picking out your destination as it is one of the best shopping malls in Chiang Mai!. Nothing beats having a long tour inside the mall with your close ones!. To do: You can find a number of great clothing stores and shoe stores alongside a supermarket that possesses all of your daily needs.
sources.shortName: The 6 Best Shopping Malls in Chiang Mai

sources.snippet: For a shopping experience that blends Chiang Mai‚Äôs rich cultural heritage with contemporary style, One Nimman is an unmissable destination. Designed with European-inspired architecture and traditional Lanna influences, this boutique shopping complex is home to artisan markets, designer stores, and high-end coffee shops.
sources.shortName: Shopping Malls in Chiang Mai

sources.snippet: One Nimman is a brand-new lifestyle mall concept in Chiang Mai; located in the hip and trendy Nimmanhaemin neighbourhood. There are numerous establishments found within the complex including shops, art and...
sources.shortName: Chiang Mai Markets & Malls

places.name: One Nimman

reviews.text:
A cool place to hang out! The architecture looks great, and the vibe is modern but cozy. There are lots of cute shops, cafes, and little art spaces to explore.

I even found a wine tasting and got to try 6 glasses for just 300 Baht! Definitely made the experience even better.

It's a nice spot to wander around. Totally worth a visit if you're in Chiang Mai!

I honestly don't have enough videos to show how cool this market center is. so modern and hip with lots of food options and shopping. Lots of times there are performances and little markets around or in the middle. In one of my photos i saw this amazing meat stand and i got the ribs and it was insane how good it was.
Very cute place to bring a date and walk around. Tons of options and it's definitely kid friendly.

One Nimman is a vibrant mix of modern European-style architecture and Chiang Mai charm. The open market area is lively and full of unique shops, local crafts, and stylish boutiques, making it a great place to wander and discover something new. The food court offers a wide range of delicious options - from local Thai street food to international flavors - all in a clean and inviting setting. The open-air design, cobblestone walkways, and clock tower create a beautiful backdrop, especially in the evening when the lights come on. In my visit, I enjoyed sipping coffee while listening to live music, then exploring the market stalls for souvenirs and handmade goods. It's a perfect place to spend a relaxed afternoon or an atmospheric evening, whether you're here to shop, eat, or just soak in the atmosphere.

places.address: 1-1, One, 1-5 Nimmanahaeminda Road, ‡πÄ‡∏°‡∏∑‡∏≠‡∏á Chiang Mai 50200, Thailand

places.generalDescription: Ploen Ruedee Night Market is a vibrant and lively destination in Chiang Mai that promises an unforgettable evening for food lovers and entertainment seekers alike. This bustling night bazaar features a spacious seating area where visitors can indulge in an array of street food, from traditional Thai dishes to international flavors. Adventurous eaters might even try some local delicacies like fried insects! The atmosphere is enhanced by live music performances, creating the perfect backdrop for enjoying delicious meals with friends or family.

sources.snippet: The Ploen Ruedee Night Market is an excellent destination for eating and shopping in Chiang Mai. It‚Äôs set up like a food park where dozens of stalls and vendors serve up mouth-watering local and international...
sources.shortName: Chiang Mai Markets & Malls

places.name: Ploen Ruedee Night Market

reviews.text:
PhaPleon Night Market is a must-visit destination for anyone looking to dive into the lively atmosphere of local culture. The market is filled with an array of food stalls, offering something for everyone. Whether you're craving traditional dishes or something more adventurous, you'll find it here.

What I appreciated most was the ample seating available throughout the market, making it easy to sit down, relax, and enjoy your meal while taking in the vibrant surroundings. The live music adds to the ambiance, creating a festive atmosphere that makes the evening even more enjoyable.

In addition to the food, there are several stalls selling handcrafted souvenirs, perfect for picking up a few unique keepsakes. And if you're in need of some relaxation, you can even grab a massage right there at the market.

Overall, PhaPleon Night Market offers a well-rounded experience with delicious food, live entertainment, and a chance to shop for unique items-all in one place. It's a great spot to spend an evening soaking up the local culture.

At night, the market opens with many many vendors on the sidewalks on both sides of the streets, that feels like there is no end.

Great place to shop for souvenirs, clothes, and accessories.  A lot of western food also available. Local food is priced slightly more than at markets that cater to locals. Based on my one visit, this night market is mostly frequented by tourists.

The old and very popular 'Ploen Ruedee Night Market,' located on Chang Klan Road, has had a big makeover,¬† It is still basically an open-air eating area with a range of food stalls, but it is now called 'Phaploen Market' and has been almost completely revamped.¬† It's a great location and can't really fail.

It still offers a stage for regular nightly entertainment, a variety of varied seating areas and now there is even a new structure offering cocktails on a second level, with fine views of the surroundings.

This week's been wet and grey with few tourists so it was pretty empty when I took a look, but I'm sure it will be as popular as before during the high season.

places.address: 28/3-4 Changklan Rd, Tambon Chang Moi, ‡πÄ‡∏°‡∏∑‡∏≠‡∏á, Chiang Mai 50100, Thailand

sources.snippet: The SFX cinema offers moviegoers an entertainment experience they won‚Äôt forget. You can watch the latest U.S. blockbuster movies, animated films, and Thai movies at the SFX cinema and enjoy an array of other entertainment amenities on the 5 th floor of the Maya Mall. A trip to the movies makes a great date night, and why not experience a relaxed and comfortable viewing of one of the latest movies with the option of recliners or love seats at the SFX cinema?
sources.shortName: Chiang Mai's Top Shopping Spot

places.name: SFX Cinema Maya Chiangmai

reviews.text: The cinema is clean and beautiful, with a First Class room that offers a welcome non-alcoholic drink, a VIP lounge, and staff who deliver unlimited drinks and popcorn right to your seat. The seating is in the form of reclining sofa beds with a thin blanket provided. The restroom is conveniently located right next to the First Class screening room. Everything was perfect.

Located on the 5th floor of Maya mall. I went to see the 13:20 Wicked show on a Monday. Bought tickets at the screen. Had trouble with 1 of them not accepting my credit card but tried another screen and it went through fine. Just my luck, as soon as the tickets printed it out, it went straight under the machine and had to find something long to fetch it back. Apparently it has happened to other customers as we found other movie tickets from a few days ago.

The theatre was huge. The seats are cushioned and they recline however you can not raise your feet up. They also offered first class seats for more. We paid 420b for 2 for standard seats. There was about 27 minutes of commercials before the movie started. It was subtitled in Thai.

We also purchased an extra large cheese flavored popcorn for 150b. It was good but very salty and we got a bottled of honey lemon tea which was too sweet.

If you wear shorts in the theater you may get a bit cold.

Watched a movie here and was impressed by how nice the cinema looked. There's a lounge that looked like a hotel's lobby. I waited there for my movie start time.

The cinema was massive. The seat was comfortable and spacious. The movie audio was good too.

places.address: 55 ‡∏´‡∏°‡∏π‡πà‡∏ó‡∏µ‡πà 5 Huay Kaew Rd, Chang Phueak, Mueang Chiang Mai District, Chiang Mai 50300, Thailand

places.generalDescription: Maya Lifestyle Shopping Center is a luxurious shopping destination in Chiang Mai, owned by the MBK group. This six-floor mega mall offers a wide array of boutiques, gift shops, eateries, and entertainment options. Visitors can explore international brands like Lacoste and Adidas as well as unique Thai shopping outlets such as Jaspal and Panpuri.

sources.snippet: Another recent addition to Chiang Mai‚Äôs shopping scene, Maya Lifestsyle Shopping Mall is conveniently situated at the northern end of Nimmanhaemin Road, a popular dining and entertainment street on the west side of Chian...
sources.shortName: Chiang Mai Shopping Malls | 7 Shopping Malls in Chiang Mai

sources.snippet:
Opening TimesWeekdays: 11am ‚Äì 9pm
Weekends: 10am ‚Äì 9pm(Directions)Built in 2014, Maya Mall is a 5 storey, super modern shopping centre on the corner of Huay Kaew road. Right next to the hipster district of Nimmanhaem, its a perfect day time activity featuring fashion boutiques, Western & Japanese restaurants, a vibrant food court and an awesome free co-working space.By night Maya becomes a slinky evening hotspot complete with rooftop bars with gorgeous views of Chiang Mai plus a state of the art cinema!. Highlights of Maya Shopping Mall SFX CinemaThai people love going to the cinema so even in small Chiang Mai there‚Äôs a modern SFX cinema complete with a Dolby sound system.
sources.shortName: 4 Must-Visit Shopping Malls in Chiang Mai

sources.snippet: In the 6-story Maya Lifestyle shopping center, you can find the best collection of boutiques and any equipment related to technology. Among the most important stores in this shopping center are the bank, the cinema and the most beautiful of all, the Sky Deck. The top floor of this store is called the Sky Deck, which offers you a unique view of the city of Chiang Mai.
sources.shortName: Enjoy a Great Shopping with Shopping Malls in Chiang Mai

sources.snippet: Located in the heart of the vibrant Nimmanhaemin area, Maya Lifestyle Shopping Center is a modern shopping complex that caters to fashion lovers, tech enthusiasts, and foodies alike. This sleek, six-story mall is home to a variety of well-known international brands, trendy local designers, and an impressive selection of electronics stores.
sources.shortName: Shopping Malls in Chiang Mai

sources.snippet: Maya lifestyle shopping mall is a beautifully structured place with six floors housing many stores by various brands. Whether you are a fashion freak, a gadget lover, movie buff, or a foodie, you will find everything here under a single roof. The products that you will come across is a mixture of Thai brands and international brands.
sources.shortName: 7 Best Shopping Malls in Chiang Mai

sources.snippet: Maya is the last addition to Chiang Mai's row of malls, opened just in 2014 with much grandeur. From outside, the mall actually looks bigger than it is, inside there aren't as many shops as in the Central's. The shops here are mostly gadgets, a food market, a Rimping and so on.
sources.shortName: Best local markets & shopping malls in Chiang Mai

places.name: MAYA Lifestyle Shopping Center

reviews.text: Beautiful Maya shopping mall!  Haven when outside is heated!  Very nice place to cool down for lunch or dinner. Excellent food court and grocery shopping.  We totally enjoyed this mall!

Maya Lifestyle Shopping Center in Chiang Mai is a modern and clean destination that's perfect for tourists. While it may not offer anything particularly unique, it's a great place to spend the day shopping, dining, and relaxing.

The view from the roof is stunning and definitely worth a visit. The coworking space is a great amenity for those looking to get some work done.

The shopping center features multiple floors of high-end shops, a spa, and several restaurants. You can enjoyed trying some local flavors, like the chicken sausage biscuit from the deli, and indulging in a Blizzard from Dairy Queen.

Overall, Maya is a great option for those looking for a comfortable and convenient shopping experience in Chiang Mai. While it may not be a must-visit destination, it's definitely worth stopping by for a day of shopping and dining.

Don't miss the view from the roof!
Take advantage of the coworking space if you need to get some work done.
- Try some of the local flavors at the restaurants and cafes.
- Be prepared for a more touristy experience.

Maya Lifestyle Shopping Center is one of the best modern malls in Chiang Mai, offering a perfect mix of shopping, dining, and entertainment. The mall is clean, spacious, and well-organized, with a great variety of international brands, local boutiques, and specialty stores. The food options are fantastic - from Thai street food at the basement food court to trendy caf√©s and international restaurants. I especially love the rooftop area, which offers beautiful city views, especially in the evening. The cinema here is top-notch, and there are plenty of events and pop-up markets happening regularly. Conveniently located near the Nimman area, it's an ideal place to shop, relax, and enjoy some air-conditioned comfort in the city.

places.address: 55, 5 Huay Kaew Rd, Chang Phueak, Mueang Chiang Mai District, Chiang Mai 50300, Thailand

places.generalDescription: Nestled in the vibrant Fa Ham area of Chiang Mai, Meechok Plaza is a delightful shopping destination that caters to both locals and visitors alike. This no-frills shopping center features an array of small outlets, local food stalls, and a well-stocked supermarket, making it your go-to spot for everyday essentials. Whether you're on the hunt for fresh vegetables or quality meats, you'll find everything you need here.

sources.snippet: Meechok Plaza is a shopping mall in Chiang Mai where travelers can shop as much as they want without worrying about spending off the entire converted currency slot they have, as it has a Bangkok Bank branch where you can easily communicate in English and get more money converted. It has a a Rimping supermarket where you will find a wide range of groceries. Parlors offer the best services at a low price.
sources.shortName: 7 Best Shopping Malls in Chiang Mai

sources.snippet: The Meechok Plaza is a shopping mall located in the Fa Ham area of Chiang Mai. This mall is a one-stop-shop for the needs of both locals and tourists, as it boasts of dozens of markets and shops, as well as essential...
sources.shortName: Chiang Mai Markets & Malls

places.name: Meechok Plaza Chiangmai

reviews.text: Nice shopping mall in faham. Has all the regular shops like rimping, wine connection etc... they have a market there as well I think on Wednesday
I like shopping in Rimping. My in law loves street market around the area where she buys pretty ready to wear clothes for her kids.

I love Meechok Plaza and its neighbouring Ruam Chok Mall.
There is so much to choose from.
Starting with the fresh market behind Ruam Chok, to the Tops supermarket, skin care clinics, cafes, Rimping Supermarket,  optical, healthfood shop, to your American food groups KFC, Pizza Hut, McDonald's and Starbucks.

There is something for everyone

places.address: 206, Fa Ham, Mueang Chiang Mai District, Chiang Mai 50300, Thailand

places.generalDescription: Anusarn Market is a vibrant traditional market located at the end of Chiang Mai Night Bazaar. It offers an array of souvenir and food stalls, as well as nightly cabaret shows for entertainment. Visitors can explore rows of stalls selling local Thai products and enjoy affordable massages and fish spa treatments for relaxation. The market also features live performances, making it a haven for art lovers. Additionally, there are various restaurants and venues where visitors can unwind with a cold beer or cocktail.

sources.snippet: If you walk further south in the Night Bazaar, you‚Äôll reach this market, which has quite a number of side restaurants and nightly cabaret shows popular among both locals and travelers. 149/24, 149 27-28 Changklan Rd, Mueang Chiang Mai District, Chiang Mai 50100, Thailand
sources.shortName: The 12 Best Streets and Markets to Go to

sources.snippet: Anusan Market holds special meaning for travellers keen on experiencing the charm of Thailand in a unique and homely space such as this one.
sources.shortName: Chiang Mai Markets & Malls

places.name: Anusarn Market

reviews.text: A tremendous range of street food. Quite enjoyed the vibe of the place. I went late in the afternoon, place was still filling up. Clothes, souvenirs, handicrafts - all there as well!

Anusran Market in Chiang Mai is a bustling local market that offers a wide variety of Thai and Western food at very affordable prices. While it's a decent spot for budget-friendly meals, the overall experience is a mixed bag-good for quick bites but lacking in some areas that prevent it from being a standout destination.

One of the market's biggest strengths is its diverse food selection. You'll find classic Thai street food like pad Thai, som tam (spicy papaya salad), grilled meats, and noodle soups, alongside Western options such as burgers, sandwiches, and pizza. The prices are very reasonable, making it a great place for travelers on a budget.

Anusran Market is a typical local market-lively, chaotic, and not the most comfortable for a relaxed meal. The seating areas are basic, often cramped, and not always clean. If you're looking for a quiet dining experience, this isn't the place.

The affordability of Anusran Market is its biggest selling point. You can easily get a filling meal for under 100 THB ($3), which is great for backpackers or those looking to save money. However, the low prices sometimes reflect in the quality-portions can be small, and ingredients aren't always the freshest.

Anusran Market is a solid option if you're looking for cheap, varied food in Chiang Mai. It's convenient, especially if you're staying nearby, and offers enough choices to satisfy different tastes. However, it doesn't stand out in terms of food quality, ambiance, or cleanliness compared to other markets like Warorot or the North Gate Jazz Co-op area.

*Pros:*
‚úî Affordable prices
‚úî Wide variety of Thai and Western food
‚úî Authentic local market experience

*Cons:*
‚úñ Inconsistent food quality
‚úñ Crowded and noisy
‚úñ Hygiene could be improved

If you're in the area and want a quick, cheap meal, Anusran Market is worth a stop. But if you're looking for the best street food in Chiang Mai, there are better options elsewhere.

Lots of food, beverages, arts, crafts and clothes on show here. It is quite a bustling night market, with traditional dance performances in the food court area. It also maintains a chill vibe and so glad I decided to check it out. Highly recommended place to visit.

places.address: 149 Changklan Rd, Chang Khlan Sub-district, Mueang Chiang Mai District, Chiang Mai 50100, Thailand

places.generalDescription: Promenada is a large and popular shopping mall in Chiang Mai, Thailand. It has a food court, supermarket, movie theater, kids' attractions, and ample parking. The mall is well-equipped for convenience shoppers with a wide variety of stores and services.

sources.snippet: A brandnew shopping mall, just opened in 2013, Promenada is the largest mall in Chiang Mai to be run by a foreign investment company rather than by Central or a Thai company. This can clearly be noticed as the Promenada's concept was probably conceived of behind a drawing table and is not perfectly catered for the Thai market. Promenada has paid a lot of attention to a wide, spacious concept with outer areas where people can repose, a thinking which would work in cold Western Europe but not in Thailand where locals like to go to inside a mall because it's airconditioned.
sources.shortName: Best local markets & shopping malls in Chiang Mai

sources.snippet: The idea behind Promenada was to create a shopping space that felt as though you were on vacation, or walking through a park with plenty of greenery, trees and ponds to help the mall blend into the natural landscape. While we‚Äôre not sure about how ‚Äònatural‚Äô this mall really is, there is plenty of good stores and restaurants to look out for, as well as a large cinema, bowling lanes and ice skating rink. Find Promenada Resort mall on Chiang Mai-Sankampaeng Road, just off the Super Highway.
sources.shortName: ¬ª Five Best Malls in Chiang Mai

sources.snippet:
Opening Times
Weekdays: 11am ‚Äì 9pm
Weekends: 10am ‚Äì 9pm(Directions)Promenada is a stunning shopping mall located south-east of Chiang Mai. Even though this mall is beautiful, because its around 20 minutes drive out from the centre, it is rarely busy.It has lots of shops, Japanese & Western restaurants, wine bars and an SF cinema. Promenada used to be busier when Chiang Mai‚Äôs Immigration office was here (moved Oct 2018).
sources.shortName: 4 Must-Visit Shopping Malls in Chiang Mai

places.name: Promenada Chiang Mai

reviews.text: My most favourtie shopping mall in Chiang Mai. There is always a parking space even if you came here during the holidays. It is never crowded. You can buy clothes , mobile phones , food , snack , etc here. There are also Thai banks , Movie theater (SF Cinema) , The Duke restaurant , Tom n Toms coffee shop , Auntie anne's , Wine Collection and many friendchise.

big beautiful mall. Not much here. many vacant stores. Still nice but needs more life. The immigration office does a good job. I got my retirement visa renewed. A lot of waiting, copies, go home a come back later, sitting. If they tell you to go to 2nd floor they mean the 3rd floor. Get copies of everything. 2k baht. Letter from bank and your bank book balance updated.

A big mall. It had a japanese festival in the center of the mall with many different food to try+ live music+ japanese kimono show(or something like that). Can't say much about the mall itself except that it also has a cinema upstairs

places.generalDescription: Chiang Mai International Airport is conveniently located just a short drive from the old city center, offering direct domestic and international flights. Travelers can easily connect to other parts of Thailand through the nearby bus terminal and train station. Within the city, various transportation options such as public buses, tuk-tuks, and ride-sharing services are available for getting around. The airport serves destinations in Asia including China, Vietnam, Singapore, Kuala Lumpur, and Hong Kong.

sources.snippet: One of the best shopping malls in Chiang Mai where you can buy the best international brands is located a few steps away from the airport. This center is open during the week from 10:30 am to 9:00 pm and on weekends and holidays from 10:00 am to 9:30 pm, so feel free to come here. In this mall, you can find high-quality souvenirs, including clothes and silk, as well as interesting handicrafts that will remind you of your memories in Chiang Mai.
sources.shortName: Enjoy a Great Shopping with Shopping Malls in Chiang Mai

places.name: Chiang Mai International Airport

reviews.text:
I traveled to Chiang Mai from Kathmandu for a climate change training, taking a connecting flight through Bangkok. My experience at Chiang Mai Airport was smooth and welcoming.

The airport is small but efficient and very easy to navigate. The scenery around the airport is lovely - surrounded by greenery and giving a warm first impression of northern Thailand. The atmosphere was calm and relaxed, quite a contrast to the busy terminals in Bangkok.

What really stood out was the hospitality of the airport staff. Everyone I interacted with was friendly, polite, and ready to assist, which made the arrival experience very comfortable.

Baggage claim was quick, signs were clear, and it didn't take long to reach the exit. While the airport isn't huge, it's clean, well-managed, and has a few shops and cafes for quick refreshments.

Overall, Chiang Mai Airport gave me a positive and peaceful welcome to the city - a great start to my visit!

Chiang Mai City in Thailand absolutely deserves a 5/5! Everything here is extremely good - from the rich history as an ancient Buddhist city to the stunning temples and mountain villages. The food is unforgettable, especially Khao Soi and Pad Thai. The cool weather adds to the charm, making every experience more enjoyable. People are friendly and welcoming, and the zoo is also a fun visit. Overall, Chiang Mai is an amazing destination that offers culture, nature, and incredible hospitality.

Chiang Mai International Airport (CNX) is a convenient and welcoming gateway to northern Thailand. Its biggest advantage is location-just a short drive from the city center-making it one of the most accessible airports in the country. Arrivals and immigration are usually smooth and efficient, with friendly staff who maintain a clean and organized environment. The airport is compact, easy to navigate, and generally hassle-free compared to much larger airports.

However, with passenger numbers increasing every year, the airport is beginning to feel outdated. During peak times, long queues can form at check-in and security, and seating space becomes limited. Dining and shopping options inside the terminal are quite basic, with limited variety and higher-than-average prices. The single runway also restricts capacity, raising concerns about handling larger aircraft and more frequent flights as tourism grows.

For the future, it would be wonderful to see upgrades that match the city's growing reputation. Expanding the terminal, improving facilities, and adding more comfortable lounges and food choices would enhance the passenger experience. With its beautiful setting surrounded by green hills, the airport could also take inspiration from Zurich Airport, blending modern infrastructure with natural landscaping to create a more refreshing, world-class gateway to Chiang Mai.

places.generalDescription: Malin Plaza, also known as Kad Na Mor Market, is a lively night market situated near Chiang Mai University. It's a popular spot among college students and young locals, drawing in crowds every evening. The market offers a variety of goods including apparel, souvenirs, and food stalls under a covered roof. Located about one kilometer west of Nimman Road, it provides a different vibe compared to the touristy night markets in the old city.

sources.snippet: Go shopping in Chiang Mai University (actually right outside it!) ‚Äì this market is where the young locals go to shop for clothing and dine at cheap restaurants, including all-you-can-eat barbeques!. 52 83150 162/51-52 ‡∏†‡∏Å.4055 Pa Tong, Kathu District, Phuket 83150, Thailand

places.name: Malin Plaza

reviews.text: Huge selection of delicious Thai food. Come and be full.

The university night market opposite Chiang Mai University is actually a gathering place for middle school and university students after school. The quality of the clothes and food there is really quite cheap. The clothes and shoes, in particular, are very suitable for students' styles, but the material quality is not very good. The whole night market is quite large.

As a tourist, I think it's okay to visit if you have time, but don't expect to find good quality clothes. If you're short on time, there's no need to make a special trip to visit.

Such a great night market, and pretty unknown to foreigners. Most of the people visiting are Thai teenagers as it is located nearby a university.

Food is cheap and great! And plenty of clothing shops here at reasonable prices. Cool stuff!

places.generalDescription: Nestled in the northwest corner of Chiang Mai, Central Outlet Kad Suan Kaew stands as a testament to the city's shopping history. Once the oldest mall in town before being acquired by the Central Group, this charming establishment boasts an exterior reminiscent of a castle and interiors that reflect traditional Chiang Mai aesthetics. While it may not have all the modern amenities found in newer malls, it offers a unique blend of local culture and shopping experiences.

sources.snippet: Chiang Mai‚Äôs most established shopping center, Central Kad Suan Kaew on Huay Kaew Road is admittedly a little dated but still offers a ton of useful shops and amenities, especially if you‚Äôre sticking around Chiang Mai fo...
sources.shortName: Chiang Mai Shopping Malls | 7 Shopping Malls in Chiang Mai

sources.snippet: Kad Suan Kaew (KSK) is historically the oldest real mall in Chiang Mai, before it was taken over by the Central Group. Noticably, the building is quite old as are the adjacent complexes (for example the Lotus Pang Suan Kaew complex). Invite a Thai friend for a cinema and chances are that he/she prefers another theater than the one in KSK because it's simply a bit older and the chairs and size are just not up to standard for them.
sources.shortName: Best local markets & shopping malls in Chiang Mai

sources.snippet: To know: Central Outlet Kad Suan Kaew Shopping Center is a perfect option to make when picking out your destination as it is the best mall in Chiang Mai!. Nothing beats having a long tour inside the mall with your close ones!. To do: You really have to check out Central Outlet Kad Suan Kaew Shopping Center!

reviews.text: Nice mall to shop and browse around. Good prices, I can see why many Thai people come to this mall instead of the other more modern ones like Maya and Central. This place also has the cheapest movie theatre that I have seen as well. If you're on a budget, definitely come to this theatre. Grocery store is located here as well if you need to shop for food
Excellent shopping and food center. Thai and India mix and a lot more. Just love it!
One of the oldest shopping malls in the city. Still has it's charm. Cheaper options than the newer malls so come here if you're looking for a discount whether it's clothes or shoes or food.

places.address: 21 Huay Kaew Rd, Suthep, Mueang Chiang Mai District, Chiang Mai 50200, Thailand

places.generalDescription: Nestled in the heart of Chiang Mai, Ruamchok Mall is a vibrant shopping destination that offers a delightful blend of local and international flavors. This covered mall features a spacious Tops supermarket alongside an adjacent local market brimming with fresh fruits and vegetables. Visitors can explore various food stalls, clothing vendors, and even enjoy drinks at nearby bars. The underground parking makes it convenient for shoppers to access this bustling hub.

sources.snippet: It is a mall which offers anything that you wish to buy; it has Tops supermarket, Rimping and several other stores with products by both local and international brands. Whether you are looking for a pharmacy store or clothes shop, you will find it all here. This place is a haven for foodies with numerous tasty dishes to indulge in and counters by internationally known food brands such as KFC, Pizza Hut, and McDonald‚Äôs.
sources.shortName: 7 Best Shopping Malls in Chiang Mai

places.name: Ruamchok Mall

reviews.text:
Has been a while since my previous visit, a lot of new additions, pleasantly surprised by the cleanliness of the fresh produce market. Great selection of things, clean, extremely polite and friendly vendors, had a great experience!

Also quite enjoyable were the food stalls and vendors outside the market, along the footpath, offering so many delicacies, snacks, and many tasty things to try.

Good fun!

We came in November 2024:
Enjoyed the night market. It's a small one. There are foods, fruits and vegetables for sales. The soya bean milk drink and dough fritters are yummy üòã Car parking is free. There's enough parking spaces when we arrived at 530PM.

Date of Visit: August 23rd

I visited through a cooking class tour. It looked like a traditional market in Chiang Mai. Since it's used by locals, the prices are very affordable. It would be a good idea to buy some fruit here.

places.address: 204 Fhaham, Fa Ham, Mueang Chiang Mai District, Chiang Mai 50300, Thailand

places.generalDescription: Kalare Night Bazaar is a bustling evening destination featuring an open food court with affordable dining options, fabric merchants, and artists. The market operates on a coupon system for food purchases. Located near Chang Khlan Road, it offers a variety of clothing stalls, accessories, souvenirs, and street food in a less crowded environment compared to the Chiang Mai Night Bazaar. Additionally, visitors can explore arcade-style shops offering paintings, traditional crafts, and jewelry.

sources.snippet: Night markets in Chiang Mai have become increasingly popular in recent years, providing a lively and exciting atmosphere for locals and tourists alike. Chiang Mai night markets are known as one of the best places to store, eat and explore in Thailand. From the colorful street vendors to the diverse food stalls, this bustling marketplace offers something for everyone.
sources.shortName: Chiang Mai Markets and Shopping Malls

sources.snippet: The Kalare Night Market is a great place to shop for bargains. It also makes a fun alternative for those who want to spend their evenings doing something else other than just drinking. This bazaar is known for selling...
sources.shortName: Chiang Mai Markets & Malls

places.name: Kalare Night Bazaar

reviews.text:
We really like this market because of its huge food court with just about every cuisine that you can think of, including vegetarian and vegan food, live entertainment, beer stands, and many interesting little shops and booths to wander through.
It's one of several of our favorite markets in the Night Bazaar and we tend to stop in here for a meal and a few drinks quite often.
Definitely take the time to check it out when you are in the night market area.

Great food, very well priced, and a good nighttime environment for tourists to hang out - the live band are also rock stars!

There are plenty of tables to sit at any one time, and the vendors are mostly Thai, with other Eastern cuisines available, lots of sweet treats to be had, but be wary of the long TikTok queues of people lining up for ice cream...

Pool tables, darts boards, cheap beers, and friendly staff make it a cool place to hang out if you're stuck for anywhere to chill for the evening. Highly recommended.

Kalare Night Bazaar ‚Äì A Must-Visit for Nightlife and Culture in Chiang Mai

Kalare Night Bazaar is one of Chiang Mai's iconic night spots, blending local culture, shopping, and vibrant nightlife. Conveniently located in the city center, it's easily accessible and perfect for an evening stroll, food tasting, and live entertainment.

The market offers a wide range of local products, souvenirs, and food stalls, catering to both tourists and locals. It's less hectic than the main Night Bazaar, which makes it ideal for those who prefer a more laid-back atmosphere while still enjoying everything Chiang Mai nightlife has to offer.

A standout highlight here is Boy Blue Bar, tucked inside Kalare. It's a must-visit for classic rock lovers! This cozy, energetic spot features talented local bands performing oldie rock hits that create a nostalgic and fun vibe. The bar is easy to find and a perfect place to relax, enjoy good music, and meet people.

Pros:
‚Ä¢	Central location in Chiang Mai's Night Bazaar area
‚Ä¢	Great mix of shopping, food, and music
‚Ä¢	Boy Blue Bar offers excellent live rock music
‚Ä¢	Friendly atmosphere and welcoming to foreigners

Cons:
‚Ä¢	Prices for food and goods can be a bit touristy
‚Ä¢	Limited local artisan products compared to other markets
‚Ä¢	Gets crowded during peak tourist season

Verdict:
Kalare Night Bazaar is a great choice for visitors looking to enjoy a mix of culture, shopping, and music. Don't miss Boy Blue Bar-one of the best places in town to experience Chiang Mai's rock music scene with a drink in hand and good vibes all around.

places.generalDescription: Icon IT Chiang Mai, located on Manee Nopparat Soi 3, is a renowned computer center in northern Thailand. It's a comprehensive destination for all IT and gadget requirements. The first floor houses various shops offering electronic spares, hard drives, USBs, security cameras, gaming laptops and accessories. While parking can be challenging for cars, it's recommended to visit by motorcycle. The center also offers home appliances and computer parts at reasonable prices.

sources.snippet: An IT mall, this mall is dedicated to electronics and gadgets, making it a paradise for all IT lovers. Whether you want to get your phone repaired or purchase a screen card, you will get all your phone-related problems solved here. It has marked a niche in the market regarding CCTV cameras.

reviews.text: Nice IT focused mall, I stopped by here to grab a USB charger for my phone and got a great deal.

We were at this shopping center looking for security cameras. This center has several shops, mainly on the first floor (the second floor does not have that many shops), selling electronic spares, hard drives, USBs, security cameras, etc. Please look at the pictures for more details.

Average place to get computer parts or fixing it. Small but you can get results, not for photo enthusiast, aiming to computer people. Restrooms are on the second floor. Worthy of 30 min tops. Prices are reasonable.

places.generalDescription: Kad Suan Kaew is a well-known shopping mall in Chiang Mai, the first ever built in the city. Despite showing signs of aging, it offers a wide variety of shops and entertainment options. The mall's location makes it easily accessible from different parts of the city, and it houses an indoor climbing wall, performing arts school, and bowling alley on its upper floors. While international fashion stores are limited, the food court is highly recommended with affordable Thai curry dishes.

sources.snippet: Opening TimesWeekdays & Weekends: 10am ‚Äì 9pm(Directions)The recently renovated Kad Suan Kaew shopping mall has to be my favourite mall in Chiang mai for a number of reasons. Firstly, its right on my doorstep (& probably yours too) so there‚Äôs no need to be waiting around for map-clueless Grab drivers.It might be a bit decrepit with more than a few areas looking like they might fall down, but in terms of sheer variety, it wins hands down.The more floors you climb, the more random it gets. It took me 2 years to realise there‚Äôs an indoor climbing wall, performing arts school and bowling alley located somewhere on the top floors.
sources.shortName: 4 Must-Visit Shopping Malls in Chiang Mai

sources.snippet: The first ever mall to be built in Chiang Mai, the long-standing Kad Suan Kaew is a shopping institution in the city, even though it doesn‚Äôt draw the same crowds as it used to. The inside is showing its age a bit, but the good thing about this mall is that its located equidistance from both Niman Road and the north-western edge of the Old City ‚Äì so walking distance if you are staying around here. International fashion stores are a bit limited, but the food court never disappoints and there is also some bowling and beers available on the top floor, good for rainy days or an afternoon out of the heat.
sources.shortName: ¬ª Five Best Malls in Chiang Mai

sources.snippet: This is a slightly dated multi-storey shopping centre found just beyond the northwest corner of the moat and is popular among visitors and local expats. Here you will find banks with an exchange bureau, four floors of Central department store, boutiques, shoe shops, endless mobile phone vendors, a sport store, computer emporium, and well-known names like Swensons, Watsons, Boots, Sizzler and a Mac izone. A bowling alley and movie house are on the upper levels and there is a kids‚Äô play area to the rear of the second floor.
sources.siteName: Chiang Mai Thailand Travel Guide - 1Stop Chiang Mai
sources.shortName: Guide to Markets and Malls in Chiang Mai - Chiang Mai Thailand Travel Guide

sources.snippet: Kad Suan Kaew (KSK) is the oldest mall in Chiang Mai and has a bit of a creepy vibe to it. Personally, I almost only go there to visit my beautician for manicures and pedicures, but I know that many westerners shop here for shoes, cosmetics, and cheap electronics. In fact it‚Äôs the place to go if you need to get your iPhone fixed in Chiang Mai.
sources.shortName: Shopping in Chiang Mai: The Best Markets, Boutiques and Malls

sources.snippet: Kad Suan Kaew department store is the oldest shopping mall in Chiang Mai, but it still has its own fans. In this store, you can not see famous international brands, but instead you can find all Thai export products with the best price and quality. This store has a food court, a cinema and a bowling alley that you can use for fun.
sources.shortName: Enjoy a Great Shopping with Shopping Malls in Chiang Mai

sources.snippet: While it may not be the most modern mall, Kad Suan Kaew is Chiang Mai‚Äôs oldest shopping centre. It offers a nostalgic shopping experience with budget-friendly clothing stores, local brands, and vintage finds.
sources.shortName: Shopping Malls in Chiang Mai
Chiang Mai Markets & Malls

reviews.text: The first mall built in Chiangmai could not keep up with the newer malls and a pandemic. It is now derelict and for sale.
This mall has everything you need.  It's not crowded so social distancing is easy.  There are plenty of hand cleansing stations.
Chiang Mai old shopping mall. You can buy clothes , glasses , medicine , etc  There are lots of restaurant here.

places.address: 21 Huay Kaew Rd, Tambon Su Thep, Amphoe Mueang Chiang Mai, Chang Wat Chiang Mai 50200, Thailand
